title: Supreme Court to Decide TikTok's Fate in Landmark First Amendment Case
introText: The Supreme Court will hear arguments on whether the government can force TikTok's sale or ban over national security concerns. The case pits free speech rights against foreign influence fears.

content.content: The case presents fundamental First Amendment questions: can the government restrict a platform used by 170 million Americans based on foreign ownership? TikTok argues the law violates free speech protections.
The Justice Department argues that Chinese ownership poses national security risks, including potential data access and content manipulation. They cite national security precedents.
A ruling against TikTok could force a sale to American buyers or result in a US ban. Creators and businesses dependent on the platform have joined legal challenges.

summary: Supreme Court to hear landmark TikTok sale-or-ban case, weighing national security concerns against First Amendment rights.
